channel.title: Shops
channel.description:
Ok so i am trying to add a shop and............ the npc isn't tradable for some reason. How would i make them tradable i added the shop into shops.cfg
and i added
[code=cpp]} else if (NPCID == 543) { // Food WOO PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = 71; // Food WOO }[/code]
and this is what i have for the shop
[code=cpp]shop = 71 Food 2 2 317 1000000 371 1000000 377 1000000 383 1000000 [/code]

item.title: Shops
item.dc:creator: @Limit101 Limit101
item.description:
@Limit101 wrote:

Well i gave up on the 1 click thing . ill just leave it but for future i looked up that sandwitch lady shop and next time ill just put in the

shop in there. so then there is no way i can be wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Shops
item.dc:creator: @WRX WRX`
item.description:
@WRX wrote:

[quote=“Limit101, post:15, topic:226390”]I just made the shop with a tradable npc…

I coulden’t get it to work with a non tradable npc…

But idk why it doesn’t work since there is a non tradable npc that is a store
(sandwitch lady)[/quote]

IT WILL WORK.
You’ve just got to make sure that it is in packet 155 okay.
I have my npcs shops opens on second click, or talk to them and ask them to trade, on the source i’m making. So i know for a fact it works. (Had alot of experience)

Read full topic

item.title: Shops
item.dc:creator: @Limit101 Limit101
item.description:
@Limit101 wrote:

Wow wtf i can’t get this shit to work i tride searching up case 155 then i search break; and added it before it and still when i click on it nothing

And yea other shops work but the 1’s i added they were already like used so they weren’t full new shops.

And this npc does not have right click trade on it i just want to click it and it goes into a shop

Read full topic

item.title: Shops
item.dc:creator: @quest_rs quest rs
item.description:
@quest_rs wrote:

do other shops in your server work? If so it is your npc config file. Place the npc in the first line for your first autospawn file if there are multiple ones.

Read full topic

item.title: Shops
item.dc:creator: @Limit101 Limit101
item.description:
@Limit101 wrote:

shop = 70 Attack3r's Shop 2 2 15187 100 shop = 71 Food 2 2 317 1000000 371 1000000 377 1000000 383 1000000

Never got the Atacck3r’s shop to work used a already tradable npc and added stuff.

Umm i hope this is what you meant if not here is the other thing

} else if (NPCID == 554) { //Gilded Shop PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = 48; //Gilded Shop } else if (NPCID == 543) { // Food WOO PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = 71; // Food WOO } else if (NPCID == 550) { //Range Shop PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = 49; //Range Shop } else if (NPCID == 520) {

K ill search for that

Read full topic

item.title: Shops
item.dc:creator: @WRX WRX`
item.description:
@WRX wrote:

[quote=“Limit101, post:8, topic:226390”]WRX im nub i don’t get the packet thing.

And quest rs i click on the npc and nothing happens at all i do not get errors and i do not get crashes.[/quote]

Do you want the NPC to open shop on one click?

Is so, search for:

case 155:

Before the:

break;

[b]Add your code, excluding the first Bracket.

@ quest rs: Nothing happens, therefore he may not have the code in the right packet.[/b]

WRX`

Read full topic

item.title: Shops
item.dc:creator: @quest_rs quest rs
item.description:
@quest_rs wrote:

what do you mean not tradeable? Error/crash or doesn’t work? There is a limit in which the shop npc must be for it to work because of the horrible coding.

[quote=“WRX`, post:6, topic:226390”][quote author=Limit101 link=topic=297447.msg2389698#msg2389698 date=1218925411]
What do you mean.
[/quote]

Packet 155 = first click NPC
Packet 17 = second click NPC

} else if (NPCID == 543) { // Food WOO
PutNPCCoords = true;
WanneShop = 71; // Food WOO
}


Should be placed in the correct packet.

@ Zarfay: You don’t know what you’re doing, i do. Get over that.

WRX`[/quote]

No you don’t know what you’re doing. It is obvious his server already has these packets and its a simple result of a horrible programmer that he is not placing the npcs in certain order.

Read full topic
